S.FORM: saumaqanu a kirimu, cuayanga ken a kiljaljavaljava tjanusun.
saomaqano a kirimo, coayanga ken a kiljaljavaljava tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: avan cu a ku sinitalem a vurati, paqayamu a keman pai!
avan co a ko sinitalem a vorati, paqayamo a keman pai!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: avan cu a qaljemeqem a vurati.
avan co a qaljemeqem a vorati.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: idu! paqayamu a keman tua ku sinitalem a kudamunu.
ido! paqayamo a keman toa ko sinitalem a kodamono.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: qaljemaqem aravac ca kudamunu.
qaljemaqem aravac ca kodamono.
qiladju! paqayamu a keman tuca ku sinitalem a puday!
qiladjo! paqayamo a keman toca ko sinitalem a poday!
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: uwa! avancu a qaljemaqem a puday.
owa! avanco a qaljemaqem a poday.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: a keman sun tuca tjianes?
a keman son toca tjianes?
inika ken a maqati a keman tua tjianes, avan a pingku a keman aken.
inika ken a maqati a keman toa tjianes, avan a pingko a keman aken.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: a keman sun tua piyapiya?
a keman son toa piyapiya?
ui, tjengelay aken a keman tua piyapiya.
oi, tjengelay aken a keman toa piyapiya.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: ku sitjuljaan sun tua kudamunu tua su kanen.
ko sitjoljaan son toa kodamono toa so kanen.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: masalu, avancu a puqetim a kudamunu.
masalo, avanco a poqetim a kodamono.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: ku sialapan sun tua zaljum tua su tekelen.
ko sialapan son toa zaljom toa so tekelen.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: masalu.
masalo.
suliavu a keman, napakaliav aken a seman djamay.
soliavo a keman, napakaliav aken a seman djamay.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: u! salum sasanguaq angata.
o! salom sasangoaq angata.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: suliavu a keman, liav anan a kinsa imaza.
soliavo a keman, liav anan a kinsa imaza.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: saka inika ken na uri malumalj!
saka inika ken na ori malomalj!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: suliavu a keman, liav anan a imaza.
soliavo a keman, liav anan a imaza.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: nasemuliav anga ken, inika ken a maqati anga patjaizua a keman.
nasemoliav anga ken, inika ken a maqati anga patjaizoa a keman.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: tucu a qadav uri kacuin mun ni sinsi a sema gade.
toco a qadav ori kacoin mon ni sinsi a sema gade.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: liav a cacalag i gade aya ti 'ina.
liav a cacalag i gade aya ti 'ina.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: tucu a qadav uri kacuin mum ni sinsi a sema vavua.
toco a qadav ori kacoin mom ni sinsi a sema vavoa.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: a vaik itjen a temuvulj ta qipu?
a vaik itjen a temovolj ta qipo?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: uri sema inu itjen tucu a qadav?
ori sema ino itjen toco a qadav?
uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema pana.
ori kacoin itjen ni sinsi a sema pana.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: uri sema inu itjen tucu a qadav?
ori sema ino itjen toco a qadav?
uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
ori kacoin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: a uri sema pana itjen tucu a qadav?
a ori sema pana itjen toco a qadav?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: ini, uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
ini, ori kacoin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: a uri vaik itjen a sema gade tucu a qadav?
a ori vaik itjen a sema gade toco a qadav?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: ini, uri vaik itjen a sema vavua tucu a qadav.
ini, ori vaik itjen a sema vavoa toco a qadav.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: sinsi, anema uri tja pacunan i pana?
sinsi, anema ori tja paconan i pana?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: vaik a pacun tua quljicacenglav.
vaik a pacon toa qoljicacenglav.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, anema uri tja pacunan i gade?
sinsi, anema ori tja paconan i gade?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: vaik itjen a pacun tua kadjiadji.
vaik itjen a pacon toa kadjiadji.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: uri kemuda itjen a sema vavua?
ori kemoda itjen a sema vavoa?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: uri vaik itjen a pacun tua tja sinitalem a puday, kinemnem itjen tua sasiq, tjainan pai!
ori vaik itjen a pacon toa tja sinitalem a poday, kinemnem itjen toa sasiq, tjainan pai!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema pana a emave'av/ljemanguy?
sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema pana a emave'av/ljemangoy?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: ini, uri vaik itjen a pacun tua quljicacenglav.
ini, ori vaik itjen a pacon toa qoljicacenglav.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema vavua a temalen tua ljaceng?
sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema vavoa a temalen toa ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: itjen a vaik a temuvulj ta qipu.
itjen a vaik a temovolj ta qipo.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: izua a minlayalayap a quljicacenglav.
izoa a minlayalayap a qoljicacenglav.
tjaupacun aken tua qaqulidan a valjualjut a quljicacenglav.
tjaopacon aken toa qaqolidan a valjoaljot a qoljicacenglav.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: izua a minlayalayap a kadjiyadji.
izoa a minlayalayap a kadjiyadji.
yi! wa! tjengelay aken aravac tua kadjiadji, bulay aravac.
yi! wa! tjengelay aken aravac toa kadjiadji, bolay aravac.
S.TRANSL: 耶! 哇! 我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: uzai a za minlayalayap a kadjiadji.
ozai a za minlayalayap a kadjiadji.
inika kadjiadji azua, tjainan azua.
inika kadjiadji azoa, tjainan azoa.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: tjimazau a pacun, maya vaivaik a sema cadja yu!
tjimazao a pacon, maya vaivaik a sema cadja yo!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: ui, inika men a uri vaik a ljiacadja.
oi, inika men a ori vaik a ljiacadja.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: inika tjen a mekekelj, gemalju itjen a djemavac avan a se'ulilj sun.
inika tjen a mekekelj, gemaljo itjen a djemavac avan a se'olilj son.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: pasa pakirimurimu aken a pacun.
pasa pakirimorimo aken a pacon.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: anema uri su pakazuanan a sema tapav?
anema ori so pakazoanan a sema tapav?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: unting aken ta sidusiya a sema tapav.
onting aken ta sidosiya a sema tapav.
anema uri pakazuanan a sema biyuing nimadju?
anema ori pakazoanan a sema biyoing nimadjo?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: djemavac timadju a sema biyuing.
djemavac timadjo a sema biyoing.
anema uri su pakazuanan a sema bukutu?
anema ori so pakazoanan a sema bokoto?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: maka hikuki aken a sema bukutu. maka hikuki aken a sema bukutu.
maka hikoki aken a sema bokoto. maka hikoki aken a sema bokoto.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: anema uri su pakazuanan a sema bukutu?
anema ori so pakazoanan a sema bokoto?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: uri maka gungkang aken a sema bukutu.
ori maka gongkang aken a sema bokoto.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: anema uri su pakazuanan a tjumaq?
anema ori so pakazoanan a tjomaq?
uri maka kisiya ken a tjumaq.
ori maka kisiya ken a tjomaq.
anema uri pakazuanan ni Sauniyaw a sema gakku?
anema ori pakazoanan ni Saoniyaw a sema gakko?
S.TRANSL: How does Sauniyaw go to school?

S.FORM: uri maka kisia ti Saniyaw a sema gakku.
ori maka kisia ti Saniyaw a sema gakko.
S.TRANSL: Saniyaw goes to school by train.

S.FORM: anema uri pakazuanan ni Api a sema kiyukai?
anema ori pakazoanan ni Api a sema kiyokai?
S.TRANSL: How does Api go to church?

S.FORM: uri maka palidring ti Api a sema kiyukai.
ori maka palidring ti Api a sema kiyokai.
S.TRANSL: Api goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: a namaka Jiyin sun a sema gakku?
a namaka Jiyin son a sema gakko?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: ini, uri maka basu aken a sema gakku.
ini, ori maka baso aken a sema gakko.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: a namaka palidring sun a sema gakku?
a namaka palidring son a sema gakko?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: ui, namaka palidring aken a sema gakku.
oi, namaka palidring aken a sema gakko.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: a namaka kauti sun a sema Takav?
a namaka kaoti son a sema Takav?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ui, uri maka kauti aken a sema Takav.
oi, ori maka kaoti aken a sema Takav.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: a namaka kisiya sun manu namaka hikuki sun a sema Kacedas?
a namaka kisiya son mano namaka hikoki son a sema Kacedas?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: a namaka kisiya sun manu namaka hikuki sun a sema Taitu?
a namaka kisiya son mano namaka hikoki son a sema Taito?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?

S.FORM: namaka hikuki aken, tja djaljav a maka hikuku tua kisiya.
namaka hikoki aken, tja djaljav a maka hikoko toa kisiya.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: a namaka basu sun manu naunting sun tua haiya a sema kiyukai?
a namaka baso son mano naonting son toa haiya a sema kiyokai?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: naunting aken tua haiya a sema kiyukai, tja djaljav a unting tua maka basu.
naonting aken toa haiya a sema kiyokai, tja djaljav a onting toa maka baso.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: a djemet a siyubai tua nu umaq?
a djemet a siyobai toa no omaq?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: inika djemet, maka utubatubai aken a sema siyubai.
inika djemet, maka otobatobai aken a sema siyobai.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: a djemet a iyubingkiyuku tua gakku?
a djemet a iyobingkiyoko toa gakko?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: djemet, djemavac itjen satje djemaljun.
djemet, djemavac itjen satje djemaljon.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: a djemet a kakanan tua tisaba?
a djemet a kakanan toa tisaba?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: djemavac itjen a palamu satje djemaljun.
djemavac itjen a palamo satje djemaljon.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走一下就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: a pucug sun tucu a qadav?
a pocog son toco a qadav?
kemuda?
kemoda?
pasa vaik aken a kivala tjanusun.
pasa vaik aken a kivala tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: izua ku saliman tucu a qadav, avanai anga nutjaivililj.
izoa ko saliman toco a qadav, avanai anga notjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: sa izua su zikang nutiav? nutiav a masukincenglj ku imav anga.
sa izoa so zikang notiav? notiav a masokincenglj ko imav anga.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: maqati a nutiav, pai ku kiljaljavai anga i tjumaq.
maqati a notiav, pai ko kiljaljavai anga i tjomaq.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: a maqati aken a lemuing? uri puvecik aken.
a maqati aken a lemoing? ori povecik aken.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: maqati! inika makuda.
maqati! inika makoda.
a maqati a semasing?
a maqati a semasing?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: inika ken a bulabulai, inika namapalimasudj a i papunemangamangan uta, mayanan wa!
inika ken a bolabolai, inika namapalimasodj a i paponemangamangan ota, mayanan wa!
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦！
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: pasasing aken numaya.
pasasing aken nomaya.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: aladji auta pasasing.
aladji aota pasasing.
masalu tua maqati aken a kivadaq tjanusun.
masalo toa maqati aken a kivadaq tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: inika makuda, anema su sikivadaq?
inika makoda, anema so sikivadaq?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: ku kivadaqay anema su sengesengan ta maqacuvucuvung sun?
ko kivadaqay anema so sengesengan ta maqacovocovong son?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: kisacu aken tasicuayan, ljakua na taigu anga ken tucu.
kisaco aken tasicoayan, ljakoa na taigo anga ken toco.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: saka izua su sengsengan tucu?
saka izoa so sengsengan toco?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: i gakku aken tucu a kipusengsengan.
i gakko aken toco a kiposengsengan.
a i qinaljan a su aljak auta?
a i qinaljan a so aljak aota?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ini, i rizuk a ku aljak.
ini, i rizok a ko aljak.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: saka macidicidilj sun imaza?
saka macidicidilj son imaza?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: izua ku paquziquzip a vatu a ita katua qayaqayam a ita, namaya tua ku sikatacemekeljan tiamadju.
izoa ko paqoziqozip a vato a ita katoa qayaqayam a ita, namaya toa ko sikatacemekeljan tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: izua ku paquziquzipen a ita a ngiyav auta, nu izua qemuziquzip a tja saladj inika tjen a masepelj.
izoa ko paqoziqozipen a ita a ngiyav aota, no izoa qemoziqozip a tja saladj inika tjen a masepelj.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: pasakivadaq aken tua paatjanu palisi nua qemaljup.
pasakivadaq aken toa paatjano palisi noa qemaljop.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: inika liav a ku kinljang, ljakua aza ku inljangan maqati ken sakamaya temevela.
inika liav a ko kinljang, ljakoa aza ko inljangan maqati ken sakamaya temevela.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: azua nu siqaljuqaljup a sauzayan anema zua a palisi?
azoa no siqaljoqaljop a saozayan anema zoa a palisi?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: azua nia siqaljuqaljup a sauzayan inika maqati a vavayan a idjadjas.
azoa nia siqaljoqaljop a saozayan inika maqati a vavayan a idjadjas.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: saka a maqati a vavayan a qemaljup?
saka a maqati a vavayan a qemaljop?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: nakuya, inika maqati a vavayan a qemaljup.
nakoya, inika maqati a vavayan a qemaljop.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Itjing, neka anga nu tja vawa i tjumaq, sau viliyu.
Itjing, neka anga no tja vawa i tjomaq, sao viliyo.
S.TRANSL: Itjing，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Itjing, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: izua anan a tjanuita i esan, mayanan a veneli!
izoa anan a tjanoita i esan, mayanan a veneli!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: inika qacuvung a tjanuita, vaiku sakamaya a veneli tu tjanudrusa.
inika qacovong a tjanoita, vaiko sakamaya a veneli to tjanodrosa.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: veneli aken ta vawa, a paveliveli mun?
veneli aken ta vawa, a paveliveli mon?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: izua! pakatjanupida sun?
izoa! pakatjanopida son?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: veneli aken tu tjanudrusa, sana veneli anan ta paday tu tjanuita i lubuk.
veneli aken to tjanodrosa, sana veneli anan ta paday to tjanoita i lobok.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: izua a paday imaza, anemanan a uri su veliin uta?
izoa a paday imaza, anemanan a ori so veliin ota?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: kinaveneli anan tua qacilu, a izua nan a qacilu?
kinaveneli anan toa qacilo, a izoa nan a qacilo?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: makapaveli anga men tua qacilu.
makapaveli anga men toa qacilo.
uri veneli aken tua itung uta.
ori veneli aken toa itong ota.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: namakuda su katjnglayan a itung?
namakoda so katjnglayan a itong?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: uri veneli aken ta itung a hansudi.
ori veneli aken ta itong a hansodi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: aicu a qudjidjilj a itung, pakananguaq sun?
aico a qodjidjilj a itong, pakanangoaq son?
a izua anan a zuma a quljav?
a izoa anan a zoma a qoljav?
izua anan a vuqavuqalj katua cangiangiya a quljav.
izoa anan a voqavoqalj katoa cangiangiya a qoljav.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: avanai azua cangiyangiya a ku veliin.
avanai azoa cangiyangiya a ko veliin.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Puljaljuyan, nakasinusun tasauni? navaik sun a undu?
Poljaljoyan, nakasinoson tasaoni? navaik son a ondo?
S.TRANSL: Puljaljuyan你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Puljaljuyan, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ini, navaik aken a pusaladj tjai vuvu a paveli tua ljacung.
ini, navaik aken a posaladj tjai vovo a paveli toa ljacong.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: ai manumaya, izua su zikang nu qazemetj? pangtjezu anga kaiv.
ai manomaya, izoa so zikang no qazemetj? pangtjezo anga kaiv.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: inika maqati, uri vaik aken a veneli tua itung.
inika maqati, ori vaik aken a veneli toa itong.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: vaik aken a kiciyur tjanusun.
vaik aken a kiciyor tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: navenala sun, pidapida cu a itavatjuan a ljaceng?
navenala son, pidapida co a itavatjoan a ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: drusapuluq a itavatjuan.
drosapoloq a itavatjoan.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: pidapida cu a vurati?
pidapida co a vorati?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: nu ita tjingtjingan tjelu a puluq.
no ita tjingtjingan tjelo a poloq.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: paveli aken tu drusa vatjuan ta ljaceng katua ita tjingtjingan a vurati numaya.
paveli aken to drosa vatjoan ta ljaceng katoa ita tjingtjingan a vorati nomaya.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Cumai, inika ken a paqenetj anga kemacu tua inpic, a maqati a su pasedjaman aken?
Comai, inika ken a paqenetj anga kemaco toa inpic, a maqati a so pasedjaman aken?
S.TRANSL: Cumai，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Cumai, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: neka nu ku inpic, ni Keljeng cu a inpic.
neka no ko inpic, ni Keljeng co a inpic.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Keljeng’s.

S.FORM: sa'a maqati a su pasedjaman aken a palamu? ku pacikelav anga nusauni.
sa'a maqati a so pasedjaman aken a palamo? ko pacikelav anga nosaoni.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: ui nanguaq, alapu.
oi nangoaq, alapo.
masalu, masalu ayau anga numaya ti Keljeng.
masalo, masalo ayao anga nomaya ti Keljeng.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Keljeng for me.

S.FORM: anema su kinasaljinga?
anema so kinasaljinga?
uri pacikel aken tuca drusa a laqulj.
ori pacikel aken toca drosa a laqolj.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: ui, anema anan auta?
oi, anema anan aota?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: uri kisedjam anan aken tua tjelu a laqulj.
ori kisedjam anan aken toa tjelo a laqolj.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: ui pai. nu makatjelulj paqenetju a pacikel.
oi pai. no makatjelolj paqenetjo a pacikel.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: inika na su pacikel tua siquliqulip tjanuaken.
inika na so pacikel toa siqoliqolip tjanoaken.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: ku pinacikel anga tatiav.
ko pinacikel anga tatiav.
nauwa, awa nekanga azua ku siquliqulip.
naowa, awa nekanga azoa ko siqoliqolip.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: aigu su sinipasedjam anga tjai Api.
aigo so sinipasedjam anga tjai Api.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Api?

S.FORM: inika ken a kemeljang. vaik aken a kivadaq tjaimadju.
inika ken a kemeljang. vaik aken a kivadaq tjaimadjo.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: ku sipasedjaman anan a ku siquliqulip tjanusun.
ko sipasedjaman anan a ko siqoliqolip tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Keljeng, a ti Kuljelje a napasedjam tjanusun tuca uba?
Keljeng, a ti Koljelje a napasedjam tjanoson toca oba?
S.TRANSL: Keljeng, did Kuljelje lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ini, vineli cu ni 'ina tjanuaken.
ini, vineli co ni 'ina tjanoaken.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: pailja mamav ca nu uba kati Kuljelje.
pailja mamav ca no oba kati Koljelje.
S.TRANSL: Kuljelje’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: qecengecengel a uba nimadju, maretimalji a quljav na nia uba.
qecengecengel a oba nimadjo, maretimalji a qoljav na nia oba.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Paules, a nakisedjam sun tjai Cumai ta paisu?
Paoles, a nakisedjam son tjai Comai ta paiso?
S.TRANSL: Paules, did you borrow money from Cumai?

S.FORM: izua, uri ku cugan timadju tucu a qadav, manu inika ken a paqenetj anga kemacu tua paisu.
izoa, ori ko cogan timadjo toco a qadav, mano inika ken a paqenetj anga kemaco toa paiso.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: saka nungida su cugan timadju?
saka nongida so cogan timadjo?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: nutiav tjara ku cugi timadju.
notiav tjara ko cogi timadjo.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: ui ku qivuavanga numaya ti Cumai.
oi ko qivoavanga nomaya ti Comai.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Cumai for you.

S.FORM: azua bisangay tja pudringayan ta qecev, azua padjavatan tja pudringayan ta seluc avanazau ququlidan.
azoa bisangay tja podringayan ta qecev, azoa padjavatan tja podringayan ta seloc avanazao qoqolidan.
S.TRANSL: 田鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: manumaya, pacevacevak aken! djaljepan inika ken a djemamadjamaq.
manomaya, pacevacevak aken! djaljepan inika ken a djemamadjamaq.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: ku tuluwai anga sun a mumalj tuazua masanmusalj tu kemuda semanaya.
ko tolowai anga son a momalj toazoa masanmosalj to kemoda semanaya.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: wa! penakaleva aravac! nu pudringay aken nutjaivililj tjara iken a makadjamaq anga.
wa! penakaleva aravac! no podringay aken notjaivililj tjara iken a makadjamaq anga.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: qaqacan anga ravac alja cemel i vavua, sau alapu ta drukudrukung a ma ubav, itjen a vaik a mavavua.
qaqacan anga ravac alja cemel i vavoa, sao alapo ta drokodrokong a ma obav, itjen a vaik a mavavoa.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: pininu a dru'udru'ung?
pinino a dro'odro'ong?
izua i ljaqediqedi ta dradra'uyan, nu semaumaqan sun ta ubav isupacuni.
izoa i ljaqediqedi ta dradra'oyan, no semaomaqan son ta obav isopaconi.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: kinemenem itjen a malap, avan a mavuciq sun, radjai aravac a dru'udru'ung.
kinemenem itjen a malap, avan a mavociq son, radjai aravac a dro'odro'ong.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷，鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: inika tja djuladjulatan a ku dringay!
inika tja djoladjolatan a ko dringay!
izainu a su dringay?
izaino a so dringay?
izua i patekuteku tuazua kasiv.
izoa i patekoteko toazoa kasiv.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: awa susipaqenetj?
awa sosipaqenetj?
ku pinukeljangan a pimaza, kemeljang aken tu ku pininu a dringay.
ko pinokeljangan a pimaza, kemeljang aken to ko pinino a dringay.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: rumue aicu, tja sikiciqaciqav cu a mapana.
romoe aico, tja sikiciqaciqav co a mapana.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: neka nu nia rumue, nu kiciqav amen avan a sipanadinadip a izua.
neka no nia romoe, no kiciqav amen avan a sipanadinadip a izoa.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: inika napavala a semeljudj tua sipanadinadip, tului anga ken nutjaivililj ui?
inika napavala a semeljodj toa sipanadinadip, toloi anga ken notjaivililj oi?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: ui lja! ari vaiki anga nutjaivililj a panadip.
oi lja! ari vaiki anga notjaivililj a panadip.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: saka ku tuluwai anga nutjaivililj tua seman rumue.
saka ko tolowai anga notjaivililj toa seman romoe.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: milalualuag anga su panadip, tjara izua anga ciqav a namakelai! pakirimu a remakac.
milaloaloag anga so panadip, tjara izoa anga ciqav a namakelai! pakirimo a remakac.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: galjuanan, midradruqai aravac ca vare'ur. tjimazaken a remakac tua panadip, sau sazuau a malap tua ami.
galjoanan, midradroqai aravac ca vare'or. tjimazaken a remakac toa panadip, sao sazoao a malap toa ami.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: rakacu a pasa maza alja ciqav, ku pusaladjai anga remakac.
rakaco a pasa maza alja ciqav, ko posaladjai anga remakac.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊，我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: aitja nanguaq auta! napakaliav itjen tucu a qadav, namapeljuq anga ca tja purur.
aitja nangoaq aota! napakaliav itjen toco a qadav, namapeljoq anga ca tja poror.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: pai cikeli a kirimu sa tja pangapangalji a masantalj.
pai cikeli a kirimo sa tja pangapangalji a masantalj.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: uzianga ti sinsi.
ozianga ti sinsi.
mayanga kivangavang, kirimu qiladju a sema tua su qiladjan.
mayanga kivangavang, kirimo qiladjo a sema toa so qiladjan.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: djavadjavay, sekavililj anga aken!
djavadjavay, sekavililj anga aken!
saumaqanu.
saomaqano.
sikamasan pidalj a qadav tucu ta tapulavayan?
sikamasan pidalj a qadav toco ta tapolavayan?
sikamasanlimalj tucu a qadav, pulavay nutuav, ari kivangavangi!
sikamasanlimalj toco a qadav, polavay notoav, ari kivangavangi!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: ui! vaiki a sema pana.
oi! vaiki a sema pana.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: sikamasan pidalj a qadav nutiav ta tapulavayan?
sikamasan pidalj a qadav notiav ta tapolavayan?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: sikamasantjelulj nutiav ta tapulavayan, vaikianga seman mali nu masukincengelj!
sikamasantjelolj notiav ta tapolavayan, vaikianga seman mali no masokincengelj!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: anema uri su salima nutiav a kadjamadjaman?
anema ori so salima notiav a kadjamadjaman?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: pulavalavay nutiav, uri vaik aken kati kina a sema kiukay.
polavalavay notiav, ori vaik aken kati kina a sema kiokay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: makuda sun?
makoda son?
pasa mutjaq aken, vaik aken a sema binziyu.
pasa motjaq aken, vaik aken a sema binziyo.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: mavengav a ku qulu.
mavengav a ko qolo.
kitjuqemu anan a kisuzelian.
kitjoqemo anan a kisozelian.
sinsi, saketju a ku tjialj, vaik a ken a sema binziyu.
sinsi, saketjo a ko tjialj, vaik a ken a sema binziyo.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: ui, pakirimu.
oi, pakirimo.
a maqati aken a sema binziyu?
a maqati aken a sema binziyo?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: uri, qemacuvung anga tja kitulu vaiku anga nusauni.
ori, qemacovong anga tja kitolo vaiko anga nosaoni.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: sinsi, saqetju a ku qulu, pulavay aken nu numasukincengelj.
sinsi, saqetjo a ko qolo, polavay aken no nomasokincengelj.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: ui, kinemenemu nu tjumaq sun.
oi, kinemenemo no tjomaq son.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: sinsi, uri pulavay aken nu tjaivililj ta sangasangasan na tapulavayan, vaik aken a kipucemel.
sinsi, ori polavay aken no tjaivililj ta sangasangasan na tapolavayan, vaik aken a kipocemel.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: ui, kanavenalavalau.
oi, kanavenalavalao.
izainu ti Muni?
izaino ti Moni?
saqetjuqetju a tjialj nimadju, sa izua timadju i binziyu.
saqetjoqetjo a tjialj nimadjo, sa izoa timadjo i binziyo.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: izainu ti Puljaljuyan?
izaino ti Poljaljoyan?
sinsi, saqetjuqetju a liqe ni Puljaljuyan, sa napulavay tucu a qadav.
sinsi, saqetjoqetjo a liqe ni Poljaljoyan, sa napolavay toco a qadav.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Puljaljuyan has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: akua inika namangetjez ti Muni?
akoa inika namangetjez ti Moni?
masezasezam timadju.
masezasezam timadjo.
kipasemalavu tjanusun.
kipasemalavo tjanoson.
ti Tjanubak a lja Tjaluigi aken, tapuluq anga ku cavilj tucu.
ti Tjanobak a lja Tjaloigi aken, tapoloq anga ko cavilj toco.
S.TRANSL: My name is Tjanubak Tjaluigi, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: tima su ngadan?
tima so ngadan?
ti Tjanubak a lja Tjaluigi a ken.
ti Tjanobak a lja Tjaloigi a ken.
aljak sun nua nema zukuan?
aljak son noa nema zokoan?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: aljak aken nua paiwan zuku.
aljak aken noa paiwan zoko.
a kacalisian a mareka su sikatacemekeljan?
a kacalisian a mareka so sikatacemekeljan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ui, paiwan zuku amen a tacekeljan.
oi, paiwan zoko amen a tacekeljan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是排灣族人。
Yes, my whole family is Paiwan.

S.FORM: a kacalisian a mareka su sikatacemekeljan?
a kacalisian a mareka so sikatacemekeljan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ini, paiwan zuku a ku kama, pairang a ku kina.
ini, paiwan zoko a ko kama, pairang a ko kina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是排灣族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Paiwan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: nima sun a aljak?
nima son a aljak?
aljak aken ni Camak a lja Tjaluigi.
aljak aken ni Camak a lja Tjaloigi.
S.TRANSL: 我是Camak a lja Tjaluig的小孩。
I am Camak a lja Tjaluig’s child.

S.FORM: a su kama azua? pida anga cavilj nimadju?
a so kama azoa? pida anga cavilj nimadjo?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: unem a puluq anga cavilj nimadju.
onem a poloq anga cavilj nimadjo.
a su kama azua? pida anga cavilj nimadju?
a so kama azoa? pida anga cavilj nimadjo?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ini, nia ramaljemaljeng timadju i qinaljan, alu a puluq anga cavilj nimadju.
ini, nia ramaljemaljeng timadjo i qinaljan, alo a poloq anga cavilj nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: pida anga cavilj nua su kaka a tjavulung tjanusun a uqaljay?
pida anga cavilj noa so kaka a tjavolong tjanoson a oqaljay?
tapuluq saka alu anga cavilj nua ku kaka a tjavulung tjanuaken a uqaljay.
tapoloq saka alo anga cavilj noa ko kaka a tjavolong tjanoaken a oqaljay.
a liav a cavilj a sikatjavulung tjanusun nua su kaka a uqaljay a tjavulung tjanusun?
a liav a cavilj a sikatjavolong tjanoson noa so kaka a oqaljay a tjavolong tjanoson?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: lima cavilj a nia didaq.
lima cavilj a nia didaq.
maudauda a su kinaqaca?
maodaoda a so kinaqaca?
taiday saka sepatj a puluq a ku kinaqaca.
taiday saka sepatj a poloq a ko kinaqaca.
aiyanga sun, nameqacanga sun ui?
aiyanga son, nameqacanga son oi?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: ui, taiday saka tjelu a puluq anga ku kinaqaca.
oi, taiday saka tjelo a poloq anga ko kinaqaca.
namekudral anga sun ui?
namekodral anga son oi?
ini, pacevak a su sipacunan.
ini, pacevak a so sipaconan.
namekuljay anga sun ui?
namekoljay anga son oi?
ini, namekudral anga ken.
ini, namekodral anga ken.
namekudral anga sun ui?
namekodral anga son oi?
ui, tjelu a puluq anga ku kinasadjelung tucu.
oi, tjelo a poloq anga ko kinasadjelong toco.
uri semainu sun?
ori semaino son?
vaik aken a sema kakizuanan a kipusalima nua sinsi a kemim tja sinsi.
vaik aken a sema kakizoanan a kiposalima noa sinsi a kemim tja sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: uri semainu ti Puljaljuyan?
ori semaino ti Poljaljoyan?
uri vaik a veneric tua cemel.
ori vaik a veneric toa cemel.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: inu ti Puljaljuyan?
ino ti Poljaljoyan?
izua i ljaljanguyan timadju, uri malalumalj ta ljemanguy timadju nusauni.
izoa i ljaljangoyan timadjo, ori malalomalj ta ljemangoy timadjo nosaoni.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: inu ti Muni? uri malalumalj ta mekelj timadju nusauni.
ino ti Moni? ori malalomalj ta mekelj timadjo nosaoni.
S.TRANSL: Muni在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Muni? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: izua timadju ta kakateveteveljan, ku vaikav a qivu timadju.
izoa timadjo ta kakateveteveljan, ko vaikav a qivo timadjo.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: pay ari sa vave'asani.
pay ari sa vave'asani.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: vaik anan aken a veneli ta ku cengelj, ku kimav anga sun nusauni.
vaik anan aken a veneli ta ko cengelj, ko kimav anga son nosaoni.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: pay ari tja qaluav a tja bintu!
pay ari tja qaloav a tja binto!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: kimu ta zuma, uri vaik aken a kemim ta sinsi.
kimo ta zoma, ori vaik aken a kemim ta sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: Puljaljuyan a uri malalumalj tucu ta cuitjiu?
Poljaljoyan a ori malalomalj toco ta coitjio?
S.TRANSL: Is Puljaljuyan competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: ini, uri malalumalj ta ljemiuvu.
ini, ori malalomalj ta ljemiovo.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: nu undukay tuazua i qadav a izua uri su kicapiljen?
no ondokay toazoa i qadav a izoa ori so kicapiljen?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: izua, uri kisaseljang aken tua malalumalj ta makelj.
izoa, ori kisaseljang aken toa malalomalj ta makelj.
nu undukay tuazua i qadav a izua uri su kicapiljen?
no ondokay toazoa i qadav a izoa ori so kicapiljen?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: uri kisaseljang aken tua malalumalj na cuitjiu.
ori kisaseljang aken toa malalomalj na coitjio.
uri kemuda itjen nu undukadukay i qadav?
ori kemoda itjen no ondokadokay i qadav?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: uri malalunalj amen tua maqaqesir.
ori malalonalj amen toa maqaqesir.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: a uri paveli tjen tua kakanen nu undukadukay?
a ori paveli tjen toa kakanen no ondokadokay?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: ini, uri paveli amen tua tjabulubululj.
ini, ori paveli amen toa tjabolobololj.
sangasangasan sun, tjalja ma'ayan!
sangasangasan son, tjalja ma'ayan!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: masalu.
masalo.
a izua i tjumaq ti vuvu i vavayan?
a izoa i tjomaq ti vovo i vavayan?
izua,na taqed i qarengan timadju.
izoa,na taqed i qarengan timadjo.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: a izua i tjumaq ti vuvu i vavayan?
a izoa i tjomaq ti vovo i vavayan?
neka, tjau vaik a casav, nu qazemezemetjang kimangetjez.
neka, tjao vaik a casav, no qazemezemetjang kimangetjez.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: a izua i tjumaq ti vuvu i uqaljay?
a izoa i tjomaq ti vovo i oqaljay?
uzai i tjaivavau sau kimu a sema vavau timadju.
ozai i tjaivavao sao kimo a sema vavao timadjo.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: a izua i tjumaq?
a izoa i tjomaq?
ti Puljaljuyan, sicuayan anga ku pinacunan tjanusun, na venala sun?
ti Poljaljoyan, sicoayan anga ko pinaconan tjanoson, na venala son?
S.TRANSL: 是Puljaljuyan阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Puljaljuyan. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: na venala ken! kemim aken tjanusun a maljavar.
na venala ken! kemim aken tjanoson a maljavar.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: inu a su kama?
ino a so kama?
seman djamadjamay i kakesan timadju, ku vaikav a qivu.
seman djamadjamay i kakesan timadjo, ko vaikav a qivo.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: na vaik anga semainu ti Muni?
na vaik anga semaino ti Moni?
vaikanga sema pukukan a djemekep ta kuka timadju.
vaikanga sema pokokan a djemekep ta koka timadjo.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: vuvu i uqaljay, mangtjez amen.
vovo i oqaljay, mangtjez amen.
neka i tjemaq a nu vava a uqaljay, vaik anga sema vavua, tjitjumatjumaqu a kitjekaljava ta mangetjez timadju.
neka i tjemaq a no vava a oqaljay, vaik anga sema vavoa, tjitjomatjomaqo a kitjekaljava ta mangetjez timadjo.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: kama i Puljaljuyan mangtjez sun?
kama i Poljaljoyan mangtjez son?
sicuayan anga ku pinacunan tjanusun, nameqacanga sun.
sicoayan anga ko pinaconan tjanoson, nameqacanga son.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: maleva ken aravac a pacun tjanusun.
maleva ken aravac a pacon tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: ku sipavavay aicu a pangudralj tjanumun, pasa zuauanga ta pingsiang.
ko sipavavay aico a pangodralj tjanomon, pasa zoaoanga ta pingsiang.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: cuacuayanga inika mangtjengtjez, ku qaqivuav tiamadju a mapuljat ta keman.
coacoayanga inika mangtjengtjez, ko qaqivoav tiamadjo a mapoljat ta keman.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: maya mavarung, nanguaq a temekel aken ta utja kaljavaljavari a sema pulaulangan.
maya mavarong, nangoaq a temekel aken ta otja kaljavaljavari a sema polaolangan.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: masalu ta su paiadja, uri vaik anga ken a cemikel.
masalo ta so paiadja, ori vaik anga ken a cemikel.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: tjau papacain aicu a kuka, kacuanga cemikel ljenguaquanga keman.
tjao papacain aico a koka, kacoanga cemikel ljengoaqoanga keman.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: kicun aken tjanusun ta nutiav a masukincengelj ui?
kicon aken tjanoson ta notiav a masokincengelj oi?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ui, mecevung itjen izainu?
oi, mecevong itjen izaino?
ecevungianga i gakku ui? uri seman iga men.
ecevongianga i gakko oi? ori seman iga men.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: sazuai i dradraiyanan numaya, uri penaiwanan aken.
sazoai i dradraiyanan nomaya, ori penaiwanan aken.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: bulay aravac nu matelak a nia sakura i qinaljan, nu padjaljun anga tuazua pangtjezuanga kemim tjanuaken.
bolay aravac no matelak a nia sakora i qinaljan, no padjaljon anga toazoa pangtjezoanga kemim tjanoaken.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: nu maitazua ikiljaljava ta kaljaveveanang, kigemaljuanga!
no maitazoa ikiljaljava ta kaljaveveanang, kigemaljoanga!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: pangetjezua nu masalutanga numaya.
pangetjezoa no masalotanga nomaya.
S.TRANSL: 那你小米收穫祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: ui!kitjekaljav ken numaya!
oi!kitjekaljav ken nomaya!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: akuazua lja cemikel sun a sema qinaljan a kikavaljutan.
akoazoa lja cemikel son a sema qinaljan a kikavaljotan.
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: uri cemikel aken a temulu.
ori cemikel aken a temolo.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: akuazua lja inika sun a sema lizuk a temulu?
akoazoa lja inika son a sema lizok a temolo?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: ayatua nasengelit aken tua ku qinaljan,na saljinga ken ta pasucikel tua ku picul ta qinaljan auta.
ayatoa nasengelit aken toa ko qinaljan,na saljinga ken ta pasocikel toa ko picol ta qinaljan aota.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: macaqu sun aravac a tjemenun, tima na temalu tjanusun?
macaqo son aravac a tjemenon, tima na temalo tjanoson?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: ku vuvu a vavayan, tjalja macaquan timadju a tjemenun i qinaljan tjanuamen.
ko vovo a vavayan, tjalja macaqoan timadjo a tjemenon i qinaljan tjanoamen.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: akuazua pasa kitulu sun ta tjemenun?
akoazoa pasa kitolo son ta tjemenon?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: nia kakudan a tjemenun,ulja nia sipatatavelak a nia kakudan aya ku kininemeneman.
nia kakodan a tjemenon,olja nia sipatatavelak a nia kakodan aya ko kininemeneman.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: aicu a vinawa sanguaq aravac.
aico a vinawa sangoaq aravac.
tiaken a na venawa.
tiaken a na venawa.
macaqu sun aravac, a cuacuay a venawa tu aicu?
macaqo son aravac, a coacoay a venawa to aico?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ini, kitjara tapulavayan, tja kesain anan a djuadjuai a paday katua paday,sa tja patatauden ata djulis, nu maitazua maqati anga pasa djilungen.
ini, kitjara tapolavayan, tja kesain anan a djoadjoai a paday katoa paday,sa tja patataoden ata djolis, no maitazoa maqati anga pasa djilongen.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: anema su sipaveliveli?
anema so sipaveliveli?
izua silji katua luciau,tiaken a na temalem.
izoa silji katoa lociao,tiaken a na temalem.
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: pida avelian nu cu a masanmusalj?
pida avelian no co a masanmosalj?
drusaiday saka lima puluq a penuljat.
drosaiday saka lima poloq a penoljat.
tjengelay aken tu aicu a itung, pida a avelian?
tjengelay aken to aico a itong, pida a avelian?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: limaiday aicu.
limaiday aico.
pazangal aravac,a maqati a ljiatekeanan a kavelian?
pazangal aravac,a maqati a ljiatekeanan a kavelian?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: inika maqati, masipun aken nu patjaiteku anan.
inika maqati, masipon aken no patjaiteko anan.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: ui! avanazua a qacengecengal a ku veliyen.
oi! avanazoa a qacengecengal a ko veliyen.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken tua aicu a siqunu katua padriyuk.
tjengelay aken toa aico a siqono katoa padriyok.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: drusa kuzulj a penuljat, tiaken a namalang, kicuacuay a su sicekaukau.
drosa kozolj a penoljat, tiaken a namalang, kicoacoay a so sicekaokao.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: ku sipasemalavan tua mareka kuqali tu veneli,a maqati a memadjulu anan.
ko sipasemalavan toa mareka koqali to veneli,a maqati a memadjolo anan.
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: ui, ku papemadjuluavanga.
oi, ko papemadjoloavanga.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: idu pacunu ta sipaveliveli a itung katua tjalupung.
ido pacono ta sipaveliveli a itong katoa tjalopong.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: pida avelian na itung?
pida avelian na itong?
nu ita itung tjelu a iday saka lima puluq, nu tjelu kuzulj.
no ita itong tjelo a iday saka lima poloq, no tjelo kozolj.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: veneli aken tu ita, pavai aken ta vaquan.
veneli aken to ita, pavai aken ta vaqoan.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: djavadjavay, pasa veneli aken tua djuadjuay a paday katua vutjulj.
djavadjavay, pasa veneli aken toa djoadjoay a paday katoa votjolj.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: mapuljatanga paday, izua anan a ciniyan a tjanaq,veneli sun?
mapoljatanga paday, izoa anan a ciniyan a tjanaq,veneli son?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: ui, paveli aken tu ita, venelianga ken nu tjaivililj ta paday.
oi, paveli aken to ita, venelianga ken no tjaivililj ta paday.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ui, ku pulubulubukay numaya, numaitucu lima puluq.
oi, ko polobolobokay nomaya, nomaitoco lima poloq.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
